sense.name: fall upon (and take spoils)
sense.examples: Sixty-five allied aeroplanes raided the coast of Belgium. Agents from the FBI and the IRS raided the Alaska home of the senator. Federal officials reportedly raided the group's headquarters. He raided the company's coffers for donut money.

sense.name: take over a company by controlling the interest of its stock
sense.examples: T. Boone Pickens raided many large companies.
